title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma, a Histological Challenge.
label: Figure 1
caption: Low power H&E slide. The lobular architecture with cribriform pattern can be identified. There is no connection to the epidermis.

title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma, a Histological Challenge.
label: Figure 2
caption: High power H&E slide. The nuclei are round to oval with conspicuous nucleoli and a finely stippled chromatin pattern.

title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma, a Histological Challenge.
label: Figure 3
caption: High power H&E slide. Both intracytoplasmic and extracellular mucin are present.

title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma, a Histological Challenge.
label: Figure 4
caption: Positive synaptophysin staining.

title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma, a Histological Challenge.
label: Figure 5
caption: Positive estrogen receptor staining (90–100%).

title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma, a Histological Challenge.
label: Figure 6
caption: Smooth muscle myosin heavy chain (SMMHC) highlights the myoepithelial cells around the lobules.

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma of the eyelid: A clinical and histological conundrum.
label: Figure 1
caption: (a) An external clinical photograph of the eyelid mass. (b) Tumor nests showing cystic, mucin-filled areas, and solid areas showing cribriform and papillary growth patterns (H and E, ×100). (c) A cribriform tumor nest at high magnification. Small, round to polygonal tumor cells displaying moderate amounts of granular, eosinophilic cytoplasm, and anisomorphic nuclei with bland chromatin and inconspicuous nucleoli (H and E, ×400). (d) Intra-tumoral mucin pools stained red with Mucicarmine stain (×100)

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma of the eyelid: A clinical and histological conundrum.
label: Figure 2
caption: The tumor cells strongly expressed CK-8 (a), CK-7 (b), and synaptophysin (c)

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma of the eyelid: A clinical and histological conundrum.
label: Figure 3
caption: The tumor cells stained positively for ER (a), PR (b), and GCDFP-15 (c). The Ki-67 index was considered low at 6% (d)

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma of the scalp treated with Mohs micrographic surgery.
label: Fig 1
caption: A and B, A 1.8-cm nontender mass on the scalp vertex, biopsy proven as EMPSGC. C, Surgical defect measuring 3.7 × 3.0 cm after 5 stages of MMS. D, Surgical reconstruction of the Mohs defect with a rotation flap.

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma of the scalp treated with Mohs micrographic surgery.
label: Fig 2
caption: A and B, Punch biopsy scalp lesion shows monomorphic epithelial cells surrounded by abundant mucin and separated by fibrous septa. C, Immunoreactivity for mucicarmine. D, Extensive immunoreactivity for synaptophysin, favoring EMPSGC of the scalp. E and F, Mohs stage I with proliferation of monomorphic small round cells surrounded by mucin.

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma (EMPSGC) of the eyelid: Clinicopathologic features, immunohistochemical findings and review of literature.
label: Figure 1
caption: Clinical presentations of endocrine mucin producing sweat gland carcinoma (EMPSGC): (a) Solid and cystic nodule on the lower eyelid with associated indentation of the eyelid margin. (b) Nodular mass involving the medial half of the upper eyelid extending up to the inner canthus

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma (EMPSGC) of the eyelid: Clinicopathologic features, immunohistochemical findings and review of literature.
label: Figure 2
caption: Light microscopic features of EMPSGC: (a) Multinodular appearance (Hematoxylin and eosin, ×40). (b) Solid and cystic dermal nodule with papillary fronds and central luminal mucin (Hematoxylin and eosin, ×40). (c) Cribriform pattern with bluish, mucinous material in the lumina (Hematoxylin and eosin, ×100). (d) Papillae with fibrovascular cores within solid nodules (Hematoxylin and eosin, ×100). (e) Nest of tumor cells floating in mucin lakes in the invasive component (Hematoxylin and eosin, ×100). (f) Mucin lakes stains positive with Alcian blue (Alcian blue, ×100)

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma (EMPSGC) of the eyelid: Clinicopathologic features, immunohistochemical findings and review of literature.
label: Figure 3
caption: Immunohistochemistry of EMPSGC. Positive staining for (a) Estrogen receptor (ER). (b) Progesterone receptor. (c) Pan-cytokeratin. (d) Cytokeratin 7. (e) Epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) and, (f) Gross cystic disease fluid protein 15 (GCDFP 15). (g) Chromogranin (CGA) and (h) Alpha-smooth muscle actin (SMA) in myoepithelial cells (×400)

title: Delayed treatment of endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma initially diagnosed as a chalazion.
label: Fig 1
caption: Clinical appearance of the lesion at presentation to principal author.

title: Delayed treatment of endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma initially diagnosed as a chalazion.
label: Fig 2
caption: A, Dome-shaped cells with pools of mucin. B, Positive staining for chromogranin A. C, Positive staining for CK7. D, Positive staining for synaptophysin. (Original magnifications: A-D, ×40.)

title: Delayed treatment of endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma initially diagnosed as a chalazion.
label: Fig 3
caption: Final Mohs defect size of 2.2 × 0.8 cm and aesthetic result 2 months postoperatively.

title: Perineural and Vascular Invasion in an Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma of the Ear with Associated Mucinous Carcinoma.
label: Fig. 1
caption: A 7-mm firm, violaceous papule on the right tragus is shown.

title: Perineural and Vascular Invasion in an Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma of the Ear with Associated Mucinous Carcinoma.
label: Fig. 2
caption: An infiltrative carcinoma with cribriform architecture and associated mucinous component is noted (100×). Vascular invasion is noted in the upper right-hand corner (arrow, 400×) and shown at higher magnification in the inset.

title: Perineural and Vascular Invasion in an Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma of the Ear with Associated Mucinous Carcinoma.
label: Fig. 3
caption: Perineural invasion is seen in the lower right-hand corner (400×).

title: A Case of Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma: Is it Still an Under-Recognized Entity?
label: Fig. 1
caption: Microscopic features of EMPSGC. a Photomicrograph shows multinodular solid tumor occupying the dermis. b A lobule of tumor cells exhibits pseudoglandular and solid papillary growth pattern with focal cystic changes. c The tumor cells are columnar in shape with mild nuclear pleomorphism and have abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. d Alcian blue/PAS stain highlights intracytoplasmic and intracystic mucin deposition.

title: A Case of Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma: Is it Still an Under-Recognized Entity?
label: Fig. 2
caption: Immunohistochemical features of EMPSGC. a The tumor cells demonstrate positive staining for cytokeratin 7. b Cytokeratin 8. c Cytokeratin 18. d Patchy staining for synaptophysin. e, f Strong nuclear staining for ER and PR. g Positive staining for GCDFP15. h SMA highlights rim of myoepithelial cells at the periphery of the tumor nodules. i p63 is also positive in the cells at the periphery of tumor lobules.

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma with regional metastases in an African American female.
label: Fig 1
caption: Physical examination of the eyelid revealed a papillated tumor measuring 15 mm × 15 mm in size with a 0.5 cm mucosal component extending from the mucosa and pushing on the inside of the eye.

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma with regional metastases in an African American female.
label: Fig 2
caption: Axial image of computed tomography scan displayed a 2.6 cm transversely by 1.7 cm anteroposteriorly mass arising at the anterior aspect of the right parotid gland, extending to the subcutaneous region compatible with lymph node metastasis (arrow points to mass).

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma with regional metastases in an African American female.
label: Fig 3
caption: Histological examination of tumor cells displayed nests of atypical glandular cells with a papillary growth pattern (hematoxylin-eosin ×25).

title: Endocrine mucin-producing sweat gland carcinoma with regional metastases in an African American female.
label: Fig 4
caption: Metastatic parotid tumor cells stained diffusely positive for CEA (×20).

title: Endocrine Mucin-Producing Sweat Gland Carcinoma: Case Presentation with a Comprehensive Review of the Literature.
